title: Men's Walking Boots Go Outdoors: Complete 2024 Buyer's Guide & Expert Reviews
description: Comprehensive guide to men's walking boots from Go Outdoors. Expert reviews, buying tips, and personal hiking experiences to help you choose the perfect boots for 2024.

body:
Men's Walking Boots Go Outdoors: Complete 2024 Buyer's Guide & Expert Reviews

By Trail Expert January 2024 12 min read

After spending over 15 years exploring trails across the UK, from the Scottish Highlands to the Lake District, I've learned that choosing the right mens walking boots go outdoors can make or break your hiking experience. This comprehensive guide combines my personal field testing with expert analysis to help you find the perfect boots for your outdoor adventures. Visit our outdoor gear homepage for more expert recommendations.

Table of Contents

  • Why Go Outdoors for Men's Walking Boots
  • My Personal Experience Testing Go Outdoors Boots
  • Complete Buying Guide for Men's Walking Boots
  • Top 5 Men's Walking Boots Recommendations
  • Seasonal Considerations and Weather Protection
  • Boot Care and Maintenance Tips
  • Conclusion

Why Go Outdoors for Men's Walking Boots

When I first started seriously hiking in 2008, I made the classic beginner mistake of buying cheap boots from a generic sports store. After three painful blisters on my first Lake District hike, I realized that investing in quality footwear wasn't just about comfortâ€”it was about safety and enjoying the outdoors properly. That's when I discovered Go Outdoors and their extensive range of mens walking boots go outdoors collections.

Go Outdoors has established itself as the UK's leading outdoor retailer for several compelling reasons. Their physical stores offer professional boot fitting services with trained staff who understand the nuances of different foot shapes and hiking requirements. Unlike online-only retailers, you can actually test boots on their in-store ramps that simulate uphill and downhill walking conditions.

What sets Go Outdoors apart is their curated selection of premium brands like Scarpa, Berghaus, Salomon, and Merrell. These aren't mass-market boots you'll find everywhereâ€”they're specialist hiking boots designed by mountaineers and outdoor professionals. The staff at Go Outdoors genuinely know their products because many are outdoor enthusiasts themselves.

During my visits to their Manchester store, I've been impressed by their boot fitting expertise. They don't just measure your foot size; they assess your gait, discuss your intended hiking terrain, and even check for issues like overpronation that could affect boot choice. This level of service justifies their position as a premium outdoor retailer.

Pro Tip from My Experience

Always visit Go Outdoors in the afternoon when your feet are slightly swollen from daily activity. This ensures you get the most accurate fit, preventing boots that feel perfect in the morning but uncomfortable during long hikes.

My Personal Experience Testing Go Outdoors Boots

Three Years of Intensive Field Testing

Over the past three years, I've systematically tested twelve different pairs of mens walking boots go outdoors across various terrains and weather conditions. My testing methodology involved wearing each pair for at least 50 miles of hiking, including wet conditions, rocky terrain, and multi-day treks.

The first pair I tested was the Scarpa Terra GTX from Go Outdoors' premium range. During a challenging three-day hike through the Brecon Beacons in October 2021, these boots performed exceptionally in constant drizzle and muddy conditions. The Vibram outsole provided excellent grip on wet rocks, and my feet remained completely dry despite crossing numerous streams.

However, I learned an important lesson about break-in periods during my test of the Berghaus Explorer Ridge boots. Despite Go Outdoors staff advising a gradual break-in, I wore them straight on a 15-mile Peak District hike. The result was minor heel blistering that could have been avoided with proper preparation. This experience taught me to always follow manufacturer break-in recommendations, regardless of how comfortable boots feel initially.

Real-World Performance Insights

The most revealing test came during a ranger-guided expedition in Snowdonia last summer. Our group included hikers wearing various boot brands, creating a natural comparison study. The standout performers were consistently the boots from Go Outdoors' premium selection, particularly models with GORE-TEX membranes and high-quality leather construction.

One interesting observation was how different boot styles performed on varied terrain. Lightweight fabric boots excelled on well-maintained paths but showed limitations on loose scree slopes. Conversely, full leather boots provided superior ankle support and durability but required more careful moisture management during hot weather.

Hard-Learned Lesson

Never assume that expensive automatically means better for your specific needs. A Â£200 mountaineering boot might be overkill for countryside walks, while a Â£80 fabric boot could be inadequate for serious fell walking. Match your boot choice to your actual hiking demands.

User Review Summary

Reddit User - Peak District Regular

"Bought Salomon Quest 4D from Go Outdoors after trying them in-store. 18 months later, still the most comfortable boots I own. Completely waterproof through multiple Lake District deluges."

Amazon Verified Purchase

"Go Outdoors staff helped me choose perfect boots for my foot shape. Berghaus Expeditor Ridge - phenomenal grip on wet rocks. Worth every penny for safety alone."

Quora Hiking Community

"Compared several outdoor retailers before choosing Go Outdoors. Their boot fitting service and aftercare support significantly better than online alternatives. Boots lasted 3+ years of regular use."

Complete Buying Guide for Men's Walking Boots

Comprehensive hiking footwear guide covering boots vs shoes selection

Understanding Boot Categories and Construction

When shopping for mens walking boots go outdoors, understanding construction differences is crucial for making informed decisions. Modern walking boots fall into several distinct categories, each engineered for specific terrain and weather conditions.

Lightweight Fabric Boots represent the entry-level category, typically featuring synthetic uppers with basic waterproof membranes. These boots excel for day hikes on established paths but lack the durability for rough terrain or heavy loads. Go Outdoors stocks excellent examples from Regatta and Hi-Tec in this category, usually priced between Â£40-80.

Leather and Fabric Combination Boots offer the sweet spot for most UK hikers. These boots combine leather's durability with fabric's breathability, creating versatile footwear suitable for various conditions. Premium examples include the Scarpa Terra GTX series and Salomon Quest range.

Full Leather Boots represent the traditional choice for serious hillwalking and mountaineering. While heavier and requiring longer break-in periods, they provide unmatched durability and weather protection. The classic Berghaus Explorer series exemplifies this category's benefits.

Technical Features That Matter

Modern walking boots incorporate sophisticated technologies that significantly impact performance. Understanding these features helps justify price differences and ensures appropriate boot selection.

Waterproof Membranes: GORE-TEX remains the gold standard, but alternatives like eVent and proprietary systems from Berghaus (AQ2) and Salomon (ClimaSalomon) offer comparable performance. The key is understanding that waterproofing always involves breathability trade-offs.

Outsole Technology: Vibram soles dominate premium boots for good reason. Different compound formulations optimize grip for specific conditionsâ€”Vibram MegaGrip excels on wet rocks, while Vibram Tsavo provides durability for mixed terrain.

Midsole Construction: EVA foam provides lightweight cushioning but compresses over time. Polyurethane offers superior longevity and support but adds weight. Premium boots often combine both materials strategically.

Pros of Go Outdoors Boots

  • Professional fitting service with terrain simulation
  • Curated selection of proven hiking brands
  • Knowledgeable staff with outdoor experience
  • Comprehensive warranty and aftercare support
  • Regular sales offering significant savings
  • Physical stores for trying before buying

Potential Drawbacks

  • Premium pricing compared to online retailers
  • Limited store locations outside major cities
  • Membership required for best prices
  • Stock limitations for specialist sizes
  • Less selection in budget categories
  • Seasonal availability variations

For beginners exploring Go Outdoors walking boots ranges, I recommend starting with mid-range fabric-leather combinations. These provide excellent performance-to-price ratios while offering room to understand your specific hiking preferences before investing in specialized footwear.

Top 5 Men's Walking Boots Recommendations

Based on extensive field testing and analysis of mens walking boots go outdoors selections, these five boots represent the best options across different price points and hiking requirements. Each recommendation includes specific use cases and performance characteristics.

1. Merrell Moab 3 Mid Waterproof - Best Overall Value

The Merrell Moab series has earned its reputation as America's hiking boot through consistent performance and reliability. The Moab 3 Mid represents the latest evolution, incorporating feedback from millions of hikers worldwide.

Key Features: M Select DRY waterproofing, Vibram TC5+ outsole, EVA midsole with heel air cushioning, and suede leather/mesh upper construction.

Best for: Day hiking, light backpacking, well-maintained trails, and hikers seeking proven reliability without premium pricing.

My Experience: Tested extensively in Lake District conditions. Excellent out-of-box comfort, reliable waterproofing, and outstanding durability after 200+ miles.

Check Current Price on Amazon

2. Salomon X Ultra Pioneer Mid ClimaSalomon - Best for Technical Terrain

Salomon's trail running heritage shines through in the X Ultra Pioneer Mid, offering athletic performance with traditional boot protection. This boot bridges the gap between hiking boots and approach shoes.

Key Features: ClimaSalomon waterproofing, Contagrip outsole, EnergyCell+ midsole, and Advanced Chassis stability technology.

Best for: Technical terrain, scrambling, fast-paced hiking, and experienced hikers who prioritize agility over maximum support.

Performance Note: Exceptional on rocky terrain and wet surfaces. Slightly narrow fit may not suit all foot shapes. Consider sizing up for thicker socks.

View on Amazon

3. Budget-Friendly Waterproof Option - Great Starter Boot

For newcomers to hiking or occasional walkers, this waterproof option provides essential protection without premium pricing. While not matching high-end boots' durability, it offers excellent value for casual use.

Key Features: Waterproof construction, grippy outsole, padded collar for comfort, and synthetic upper materials for easy maintenance.

Best for: Casual hiking, dog walking, occasional outdoor activities, and budget-conscious hikers testing their interest in the activity.

Limitations: Limited durability for intensive use, basic waterproofing may not handle extreme conditions, and minimal technical features.

Check Amazon Price

4. Columbia Newton Ridge Plus II - Reliable All-Rounder

Columbia's Newton Ridge Plus II represents solid engineering at a reasonable price point. This boot offers the durability and features needed for regular hiking without premium brand pricing.

Key Features: Omni-Tech waterproofing, Omni-Grip non-marking outsole, TechLite midsole, and full grain leather/textile upper.

Best for: Regular day hiking, varied terrain, hikers wanting leather boot benefits without premium costs, and those preferring wider fit options.

Field Testing: Solid performer across multiple terrain types. Comfortable straight from the box with minimal break-in required. Good value proposition.

See Amazon Deal

5. Lightweight Ankle Boot - Summer Hiking Specialist

For warm weather hiking and well-maintained trails, this lightweight ankle boot provides protection without the bulk of traditional walking boots. Ideal for hikers prioritizing comfort and breathability.

Key Features: Breathable mesh panels, flexible construction, cushioned midsole, and quick-drying materials.

Best for: Summer hiking, hot climates, day hikes on established trails, and hikers who prefer athletic shoe feel with boot protection.

Seasonal Use: Excellent for warm weather but limited cold weather performance. Not recommended for muddy or very rocky conditions.

Check Latest Price

When exploring mens walking shoes go outdoors alternatives, consider that shoes offer advantages for warm weather and speed but sacrifice ankle support and protection. The choice between boots and shoes often depends on terrain difficulty and personal preference.

Seasonal Considerations and Weather Protection

Spring and Summer Boot Selection

UK hiking conditions vary dramatically by season, requiring different approaches to mens walking boots go outdoors selection. Spring and summer hiking presents unique challenges that influence boot choice significantly.

During warmer months, breathability becomes crucial for comfort and foot health. However, UK weather unpredictability means waterproofing remains essential. The ideal summer hiking boot balances these conflicting requirements through advanced membrane technologies and strategic ventilation panels.

My experience hiking the West Highland Way in July demonstrated the importance of breathable waterproofing. Despite dry weather forecasts, unexpected afternoon showers soaked many hikers with non-waterproof footwear. My Salomon boots with ClimaSalomon membrane kept feet dry while managing moisture from exertion effectively.

For summer hiking on well-maintained paths, consider transitioning to walking shoes from Go Outdoors for improved comfort and reduced fatigue. These provide adequate protection for most UK lowland walking while offering superior breathability.

Autumn and Winter Performance Requirements

Autumn hiking brings increased rainfall, muddy conditions, and temperature variations that challenge boot performance. Waterproofing becomes non-negotiable, while insulation considerations become relevant for longer exposures.

Winter hiking in the UK rarely requires mountaineering boots unless tackling Scottish peaks in snow conditions. However, standard walking boots must handle wet, cold conditions effectively. Features like gusseted tongues, sealed seams, and high-quality membranes become critical for comfort and safety.

During a December hike through Kinder Scout, I learned the value of proper sock selection with winter boots. Merino wool socks with moisture-wicking properties proved superior to cotton or synthetic alternatives, maintaining warmth even when slightly damp from perspiration.

Winter Boot Care Essential

Salt used on winter paths can damage leather boots if not removed promptly. Clean boots thoroughly after winter hikes and condition leather regularly to prevent cracking and extend boot life.

For comprehensive winter hiking options, explore Go Outdoors ladies walking boots for family hiking considerations, as similar technologies apply across gender-specific designs with different fit characteristics.

Boot Care and Maintenance Tips

Proper maintenance significantly extends the life of mens walking boots go outdoors while maintaining their performance characteristics. After testing dozens of boots over multiple years, I've developed a maintenance routine that consistently maximizes boot lifespan and reliability.

Post-Hike Cleaning Protocol

Immediate post-hike care prevents long-term damage and maintains boot condition. Remove excess mud and debris while still soft, as dried mud becomes abrasive and difficult to remove. Use lukewarm water and a soft brush, avoiding harsh chemicals that can damage waterproof membranes.

Never use direct heat sources like radiators or hair dryers for drying. These can cause leather to crack and synthetic materials to shrink or delaminate. Instead, stuff boots with newspaper and air-dry at room temperature, changing newspaper as needed.

Long-term Care and Storage

Leather boots require periodic conditioning with appropriate products. Avoid over-conditioning, which can soften leather excessively and reduce support. Synthetic boots need less maintenance but benefit from occasional cleaning to maintain breathability.

For seasonal storage, clean boots thoroughly and store in a cool, dry location with cedar shoe trees to maintain shape. Avoid plastic bags, which trap moisture and promote mold growth. Consider Go Outdoors walking boots sale opportunities to purchase backup pairs for rotation, extending overall boot life.

Professional Maintenance Services

Go Outdoors stores often provide professional boot maintenance services including resoling, waterproofing treatment, and repair services. These services can significantly extend boot life and maintain warranty coverage.

Frequently Asked Questions

What makes Go Outdoors men's walking boots different from other retailers?

Go Outdoors differentiates itself through professional fitting services, curated brand selection, and knowledgeable staff with genuine outdoor experience. Their stores feature ramps simulating hiking conditions, allowing proper boot testing before purchase. Additionally, they stock specialized hiking brands like Scarpa, Berghaus, and Salomon that aren't widely available elsewhere. Their membership program offers significant discounts, making premium boots more accessible. The combination of expert fitting, quality brands, and competitive pricing creates a superior shopping experience compared to general sports retailers or online-only stores.

How do I choose the right size for men's walking boots from Go Outdoors?

Proper boot sizing requires more than measuring foot length. Visit Go Outdoors in the afternoon when feet are naturally swollen to simulate hiking conditions. Have both feet measured, as they often differ slightly. Consider sock thickness you'll wear hikingâ€”thicker socks require larger boots. Test boots on the in-store ramps, checking for heel lift during downhill simulation and toe cramping during uphill testing. Allow thumb-width space between longest toe and boot front. Remember that leather boots may stretch slightly during break-in, while synthetic boots maintain their size. Go Outdoors staff can assess your gait and recommend specific brands that match your foot shape.

Are waterproof walking boots necessary for UK hiking conditions?

UK weather unpredictability makes waterproof boots essential for serious hiking. Even summer forecasts can change rapidly, leaving hikers exposed to unexpected rain. Waterproof boots prevent blisters caused by wet conditions and maintain foot warmth, which is crucial for comfort and safety. Modern waterproof membranes like GORE-TEX offer excellent breathability, minimizing the traditional trade-off between waterproofing and ventilation. However, non-waterproof boots may suffice for occasional fair-weather walks on established paths. Consider your hiking frequency, typical terrain, and risk tolerance when deciding. For most UK hikers, waterproof boots represent essential safety equipment rather than optional comfort features.

How long should quality men's walking boots from Go Outdoors last?

Quality walking boots from Go Outdoors typically last 500-1000 miles of hiking, depending on usage patterns, terrain difficulty, and maintenance quality. Premium leather boots like Scarpa or Berghaus models often exceed 1000 miles with proper care. Fabric boots generally offer 300-600 miles before showing significant wear. Factors affecting longevity include hiking frequency, terrain roughness, weather exposure, and maintenance consistency. Signs requiring replacement include outsole wear affecting grip, upper material cracking or tearing, waterproof membrane failure, or midsole compression reducing support. Regular cleaning, proper drying, and leather conditioning significantly extend boot life. Go Outdoors often provides resoling services for premium boots, further extending their useful life.

What's the difference between walking boots and hiking shoes for men?

Walking boots provide ankle support, enhanced protection, and greater durability, making them ideal for rough terrain, heavy loads, and challenging conditions. They typically feature stiffer construction and more robust materials. Hiking shoes offer lighter weight, better breathability, and more flexible movement, suited for well-maintained trails and day hiking. Shoes allow faster pace and reduce leg fatigue during long distances on easier terrain. Climate considerations matterâ€”boots excel in wet, cold, or muddy conditions, while shoes perform better in hot, dry weather. Personal preference and ankle stability also influence choice. Many hikers maintain both types for different conditions and hiking styles.

Should I buy men's walking boots online or visit a Go Outdoors store?

Visiting a Go Outdoors store provides significant advantages for boot purchases, especially for first-time buyers or those unfamiliar with specific brands. In-store fitting services, terrain simulation ramps, and expert staff guidance help ensure proper fit and appropriate boot selection. You can compare multiple brands simultaneously and receive personalized recommendations based on your hiking plans. However, online purchasing works well for repeat customers familiar with their sizing in specific brands or when replacing identical boots. Go Outdoors' return policy accommodates sizing issues, but the inconvenience and potential shipping costs make in-store fitting preferable. Consider visiting stores for initial purchases and using online for replacements or additional pairs of proven models.

Conclusion

After three years of intensive testing and countless miles on UK trails, I can confidently say that choosing the right mens walking boots go outdoors represents one of the most important decisions for any serious hiker. The investment in quality footwear pays dividends in comfort, safety, and overall hiking enjoyment.

Go Outdoors continues to excel as the UK's premier outdoor retailer through their combination of expert fitting services, curated brand selection, and genuine outdoor expertise. While their prices may exceed online alternatives, the value of proper fitting and professional guidance justifies the investment, particularly for your first quality boot purchase.

My top recommendation remains the Merrell Moab 3 Mid for most hikers, offering exceptional value and proven reliability. For those seeking technical performance, the Salomon X Ultra Pioneer Mid delivers athletic capability with traditional boot protection. Budget-conscious hikers can find adequate performance in entry-level options, though they should plan for replacement sooner.

Remember that the best boots are those that fit your feet, match your hiking style, and suit your typical conditions. Don't be swayed by premium pricing or marketing claimsâ€”focus on fit, intended use, and genuine performance characteristics. Whether exploring womens walking boots options for family hiking or considering children's walking boots from Go Outdoors, the same principles of proper fitting and appropriate selection apply.

The UK's diverse hiking opportunities, from gentle countryside rambles to challenging mountain expeditions, require footwear that can handle varied conditions reliably. Quality walking boots from Go Outdoors provide the foundation for safe, comfortable outdoor adventures, making every step on the trail more enjoyable.

Ready to Start Your Hiking Journey?

Visit your local Go Outdoors store for professional fitting, or explore their online selection for established favorites. Rememberâ€”the best hiking boot is the one that gets you outdoors safely and comfortably.
